Lamichhane bail Rs 2 million bench Justice Hari Phuyal sought documents related case police complaint High Court’s order OAG registered application demanding Lamichhane kept judicial custody rape trial joint bench Judges Dhruba Raj Nanda Ramesh Dhakal hearing appeal Kathmandu District Court’s order send Lamichhane judicial custody case raping minor January 12 decided revoke Kathmandu District Court’s order citing lack grounds keep custody released bail Rs 2 million next day OAG argued Patan High Court’s order release Lamichhane bail legal provisions SC’s interpretation bail hearing cases similar nature Clause 27 National Criminal Procedure Code Act 2017 clear provision holding accused offense punishable imprisonment term exceeding three years detention based evidence available accused appears guilty offense reasonable ground based evidence believe person guilty offense Lamichhane released bail despite subsection 3 Section 219 National Penal Code Act 2017 stating person commits rape shall liable imprisonment term 10 12 years woman 16 16 years age 18 years age victim case 17 years Patan High Court ordered Lamichhane’s release five conditions sent back prison found violated conditions court prohibited Lamichhane traveling abroad also required obtain permission District Police Range Kathmandu leaving Kathmandu Valley court also asked police monitor activities Lamichhane live Kathmandu release father Chandra Narayan said left Chitwan living Kathmandu ever since case began Lamichhane’s lawyers appealed Kathmandu District Court’s order November 4 send judicial custody case decided Lamichhane kept Central Jail Jagannath Dewal Patan High Court earlier ordered documents hospital victim born ascertain actual age Lamichhanes defense alleged actually minor District age also sought compensation victim Lamichhane denied rape allegation statements DGAO police admitted staying girl room hotel Kathmandu August 21 said girl slept bed slept chair night Lamichhane
